text: pronunciation of English vowel sounds
lesson 2 front vowels part 2
among these front vowel sounds do you
remember which ones are long and which
ones are short the long sounds are e and
a the short sounds are it a ah now these
are the basic qualities the basic sounds
that they have but the length can change
depending on the surrounding sounds once
it's inside a word let me explain by
giving an example let's do feet
and feed feet feed let me say them again
and see if you can hear which one has a
longer vowel sound feet feed feet feed
this has a longer vowel sound because
the D is a voice down to the T is
unvoiced voiceless no sound no sound
from our voice do so when there is a
voiced consonant sound after a vowel
sound the vowel sound becomes longer the
vowel sound is shorter when it's
followed by a voiceless consonant so
this has the same valve II but it's
shorter here and longer here so
depending on what follows the vowel
sound it can be shorter or longer watch
also if we have no following consonant
sound fee fee it's long isn't it so here
fee and feed have a long vowel sound
here it's a bit shorter because of that
T that follows the voiceless consonant
alright let me throw one more thing at
you let's take the same sound and talk
about these words
T
and pretty tea has this sound and pretty
at the end the wine has the sound right
but where is the sound longer tea pretty
here we have the e sound and it's not
followed by any consonant sound so it's
nice and long here it's not followed by
anything but it's not stressed this
first half of the word this first
syllable is stronger the second half is
weaker it's not stressed so when you
have this vowel sound in an unstressed
syllable it's a shorter sound T pretty T
pretty so to summarise vowel sounds are
longer when they are not followed by a
consonant sound when they're followed by
a voiced consonant sound and when
they're stressed they're shorter in
weaker positions vowel sounds are
shorter when they're not stressed or
when they're followed by a voiceless
consonant
exercise answer the questions one say
kiss and case which vowel sound is
longer the a in case is longer to say
cage and case which vowel sound is
longer the a in cage is longer because
it's followed by a voiced consonant June
in contrast the a in case is followed by
a voiceless consonant again cage case
three say key and K for which vowel
sound is your mouth more open your mouth
should be more open for the a and K for
say kid and cat for which vowel sound is
your mouth more open your mouth should
be more open for the a in cat
five say bed and bad for which found is
your mouth more relaxed it should be
more relaxed for the e in bed remember
for front vowels you need to spread your
lips but note that your mouth is more
tense for the vowel sounds e a at and
your mouth is more relaxed for the vowel
sounds e n also move your tongue forward
but keep the very tip down near the back
of your bottom front teeth
open your mouth more as you say the
front vowels from E to AB e a a a your
mouth should open more and more as you
go through that sequence and finally
note that short vowel sounds are a and
long vowel sounds are e a
let's say our front vowel sounds one
last time e in a a ah
ii-if a half
